CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 21, 1953, pg. 3, reads: "Wish We Could Play - Life for Harold, 10, right, and Robert, 8, left, means being on the inside looking out. They have muscular dystrophy and can't walk.  They sit by the window daily in one-room home shared by the family of seven at 1541 Centre Avenue, and long for the day when they can play like other boys.  Their mother, Mrs. Edna Williams, has been trying to find a larger space for years. - Harris Photos."
TitMainTitle: Robert Williams and Harold Williams posed in window of their one room apartment, 1541 Centre Avenue, Hill District
